flow.descriptionCdata:
94025c71-8279-4fbb-9877-7b2d5ca7570c.1af87b27-6801-4c2e-be18-2ba9a9cc6a88.description=
Appends a flow variable in the local context.

Input Parameters\:
varName - the name of the flow variable to use
valueToAppend - value to append

Responses\:
success - assigned the flow variable
94025c71-8279-4fbb-9877-7b2d5ca7570c.271548a5-e0a3-4037-8691-65cd2c802799.description=
Appends a flow variable in the local context.

Input Parameters\:
varName - the name of the flow variable to use
valueToAppend - value to append

Responses\:
success - assigned the flow variable
94025c71-8279-4fbb-9877-7b2d5ca7570c.3134574a-1b05-455c-afbd-108e5bdc4cf1.description=
Operation to check for null or empty string local variables.

Inputs\:

inputList\:  comma seperated list of variables to check

Reponsses\:
hasNull\:  at least one variable is null or has an empy string for a value
noNulls\:  all variables have a value

Result\:  List of variables that are null or empty strings
94025c71-8279-4fbb-9877-7b2d5ca7570c.4a1a98bb-7333-4033-8c9e-50a519ada64c.description=
Allows a user to select how they should be notified of the outcome of a flow, and shows them a message in that way.

Inputs\:
notifyData -  The text of the notification message.
notifyMethod - The method of notification (Write to File, Email, Display or None). This value is case-insensitive.
subject - A description of what the notification is about. 
destination - The destination of the notification (email address or filename). This field is required when notifyMethod is Email or Write to File.
notificationServer - The email server to send the notification through. This field is required when notifyMethod is Email.
from - The originator of the message (email "from" address).This field is required when notifyMethod is Email.
serverPort - The port the service to notify on the server is running on. This field used when notifyMethod is Email, and it is optional (it defaults to 25 if not specified).
htmlEmail - Default value is true. The value should be true if the email is in rich text/html format. The value should be false to send the email in plain text format.

Responses\:
success - The user was notified.
failure - Notification failed.

As mentioned above, some inputs are required for certain types of notification methods. In order to schedule a flow that in turn uses this flow, all of the required fields for the given notification method must be supplied, or else the flow will not be able to execute to completion. For example, if "notifyMethod" is "File", then the "destination" input must also be specified.
94025c71-8279-4fbb-9877-7b2d5ca7570c.4dce9558-a8c1-438a-8a7b-374414768941.description=
Adds a flow variable into the local context (available to itself and child flows only)

Input Parameters\:
keyName - the name of the flow variable to use
myValue - the value to assign the flow variable

Responses\:
success - assigned the flow variable

Scriptlet Example\:
[$scriptletContext putGlobal\: $keyName, $myValue];
94025c71-8279-4fbb-9877-7b2d5ca7570c.a9284053-8304-47a8-8150-b76508bff5ab.description=
Adds a flow variable into the local context (available to itself and child flows only)

Input Parameters\:
keyName - the name of the flow variable to use
myValue - the value to assign the flow variable

Responses\:
success - assigned the flow variable

Scriptlet Example\:
[$scriptletContext putGlobal\: $keyName, $myValue];
94025c71-8279-4fbb-9877-7b2d5ca7570c.da2deb08-ce95-4e3d-9200-9bc8b7ac730a.callout=configshow 94025c71-8279-4fbb-9877-7b2d5ca7570c.description=

Synopsis\:
  This flow creates the zone to all AliasLif (multiple) to netapphost (multiple), cfgsave, cfgadd, and runs nszonemember output information.

1) Check for Nulls, init vars
2) Connect to HPNA (JRAS or HPNA), run nszonemember, zonecreate, etc, cfgsave, cfgadd...
3) Output success/failure and new alias info.

"Mandatory" (checkForNull) Inputs\:
hostalias_list - host
netapplif_list - lifs to connect to host

Results\:
 flowOutput -new alias information, XML format.

Responses\:
failure - Either couldn't connect to device, or 1 or more commands failed against ${deviceIP}
success - Ran all commands successfully against ${deviceIP}
94025c71-8279-4fbb-9877-7b2d5ca7570c.e00922e4-1fac-4062-bae9-a17f2bd5f9c4.description=

Synopsis\:
  This flow handles all the low-level operations and use-cases for CLU within HPOO, running on HPNA.  This lets HPOO handle the entire request per higher-level inputs, including "overload" variables to the command line using variable-names within ${commands}.

Note\: Actual script libraries on $override_JRAS is running here\:  /data01/hosteng/Common_Library.tcl

1) Check for Nulls, init vars
2) Javascript operator converts local HPOO variables into "index1\=value1 index2\=value2..." format
3) Operator runs command\:/usr/bin/execpt against local RAS script on $override_JRAS

"Mandatory" (checkForNull) Inputs\:
runas_vendor	- HPOO needs override $tc_device_vendor$ to interpret prompts properly.  This to bypass CLU trying to get vendor information from HPNA rules.
router		- Device target IP or DNS

Results\:
 flowOutput - Raw data back from ssh/telnet to $router commands

Responses\:
failure - Either couldn't connect to device, or 1 or more commands failed against ${router}
success - Ran all commands successfully against ${router}
flow.name: backupBrocadeRas
